whitecat.core.role.descriptors
Class AbstractDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  whitecat.core.role.descriptors.AbstractDescriptor
Direct Known Subclasses:
EventDescriptor, OperationDescriptor, RoleDescriptor
public abstract class AbstractDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object

The base for all the descriptors tied to roles. This base provides the main functionalities for each descriptor, as described in the article Injecting roles in Java agents through runtime bytecode manipulation IBM SYSTEMS JOURNAL, VOL 44, NO 1, 2005 . Even if this implementation is inspired by the above article, it presents a better modularity and organization of methods and properties, as well as the adoption of a collections instead of plain arrays. Please note that this class is abstract and that the properties can be publically read, but not written, in order to not allow an external process to change the descriptor.

Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net

Field Detail

name

private java.lang.String name
The name of this descriptor, used for basic lookup of the descriptor.

aim

private java.lang.String aim
The aim of the role this descriptor is tied to.

version

private float version
The version of this descriptor, used to understand if the role descriptor is up-to-date. By default the version of this descriptors is 2.

creationDate

private java.util.Date creationDate
The creation date of this descriptor.

keywords

private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keywords
A set of keywords tied to this descriptor.
